thread.title: Did Drake Pass LeBron James a Copy of 'More Life' Months Ago?
thread.title_full: Did Drake Pass LeBron James a Copy of 'More Life' Months Ago?

author: NHHMS
title: Did Drake Pass LeBron James a Copy of 'More Life' Months Ago?
text:
http://www.billboard.com/files/styles/promo_225/public/media/drake-hakkasan-portrait-2016-billboard-1548.jpg 
It’s good to be The King. 
While Drake’s fans clamour in record numbers to Spotify, Apple Music and other streaming services for a listen to his latest album, More Life , it’s worth considering LeBron James may have been living with Drizzy’s new music for some months already. 
The NBA superstar posted a cryptic comment on Twitter in late January, which many assumed was a thread to a comical back-and-forth with retired basketball legend Charles Barkley. 
“Sometimes I gotta just make sure that i didn’t lose you. Did I?!?! Did I?!?! Did I Lose You,” wrote James. Turns out those lyrics are almost a word-for-word repeat of the chorus for “Lose You,” which appears on Drizzy’s new album. Sometimes I gotta just make sure that i didn’t lose you. Did I?!?! Did I?!?! Did I Lose You 
— LeBron James (@KingJames) January 31, 2017 
Drake and James’ worlds collide regularly. The Canadian hip-hop star was appointed team ambassado r to the NBA’s Toronto Raptors in 2013, and he’s a regular courtside at home games… especially when James’ champion Cleveland Cavs roll into town. Did the IFPI’s reigning Global Recording Artist of the Year flick the four-time NBA MVP a preview copy of his new set? 
Yeah, it’s good to be The King. TAGS
